text: Suwanee medical students have joined together to offer free grocery service for the elderly and medically isolated individuals. This is yet another incredible example of #GA07 residents going above and beyond to lend a helping hand during this pandemic. https://t.co/s3qrFN45G3

Volunteers in #GA07 have sewed thousands of medical masks and delivered them to local clinics and hospitals to address the current shortage. It’s incredible to see our community unite during these turbulent times and do what is takes to help those in need.https://t.co/5Oo2OWRVpS

Despite being a difficult time for the industry, restaurants across #GA07 have come together to take care of our health care professionals. These are incredible acts of kindness, and they go a long way to helping our community combat the spread of COVID-19.https://t.co/7z9cypksV6

Today on #NationalDoctorsDay, it’s important to recognize the strength and hard work of all our health care professionals who are doing everything possible to care for our friends, neighbors, and loved ones during this pandemic.
 
I thank you for your dedicated service. https://t.co/bjExQKCP7a

Tax Day has been officially moved from April 15 to July 15. All taxpayers and businesses can use this additional time to file and make payments without interest or penalties.
https://t.co/qZ8ynAjNNd

I’m grateful to the @forsythchamber for offering small businesses assistance with navigating the SBA loan application.
 
Neighbors helping neighbors is how we will get through these turbulent times, and I thank the Chamber for leading the way.

For more information on the “Divided Families Reunification Act,” click the link below:

Today, the House passed my bill, the “Divided Families Reunification Act,” which would help reunite Korean Americans with family members in North Korea.

I expect this measure to receive similar bipartisan support as it heads to the Senate for further consideration. https://t.co/sI01vX8Tnj

Today, the House passed a bipartisan funding bill to help combat the coronavirus. 

These funds will help to expedite vaccine development, procure necessary equipment and hospital supplies, and help local authorities directly address the outbreak.

Read the current COVID-19 testing protocols if you think you’ve been exposed, and call your doctor before you go to the hospital to prevent further disease spread. I’ll share more CDC-approved info as we get it. https://t.co/eFK3oR3Ooi

The CDC has urged Americans to institute normal procedures for preventing disease, including regular hand washing. Visit the CDC’s website for information about how to stay safe. https://t.co/uYs2dbGGhZ

Georgia Gwinnett College stopped by my office in Washington yesterday to discuss a variety of issues most important to them.
 
It’s an honor to partner with you all to find meaningful solutions for the greatest number of Americans. https://t.co/hBFa9xWapE

The @ModernizeCmte is helping to build a Congress that better serves the American people. 

I would like to thank @RepDerekKilmer and @RepTomGraves who took to the House floor Tuesday to submit the Committee’s first report and highlight our bipartisan work. https://t.co/Ca9zH8GZnI

During #NationalPublicSchoolsWeek, I want to recognize all the incredible educators who go above and beyond to prepare our children to be the leaders of tomorrow. 

It's always a privilege to visit these bright young minds and see first-hand the success of our schools. https://t.co/ibgmEsWWcg

Our community is made better through your incredible compassion #ThankACaregiver

Over the past 17 years, Donald Bagley has been donating platelets nearly twice a month, helping an estimated 750 cancer, surgery, and emergency patients. 

I would like to thank Donald for his dedication to helping others and saving lives. https://t.co/kUlEwbDYle

Last week, Forsyth County Schools earned a spot on College Board’s AP District Honor Roll list – 1 of only 5 school districts in GA to receive this honor! 

Congrats to the parents, students, and faculty who worked hard to make this achievement possible. https://t.co/1vLfIG4ctx
While Congress is back home this week, don’t miss the opportunity to catch up on Capitol Hill’s latest legislative business: https://t.co/gYawUIZYEf

Last year, Rep. Grace Meng and I introduced H.R. 1771 to compel the State Department to help American families reunite with their loved ones in North Korea. 

To learn more about this bipartisan bill, check out my recent interview with Radio Free Asia: https://t.co/bNBTraJBMX

Yesterday, I had the opportunity to review the President's budget for FY 2021, and I am encouraged to see a plan that takes meaningful steps to tackle our ever-increasing mandatory spending. 

Correcting our America's fiscal trajectory should be Congress’ top priority.

Capitol Hill was at the center of a busy news cycle last week – from President Trump’s State of the Union Address on Tuesday to his impeachment acquittal not 24 hours later. 

It can be hard to keep up, but my weekly newsletter has you covered: https://t.co/f3DOyFhWxF

Weight limits on Federal highways force large trucks onto two-lane highways and rural roads, which can be inefficient and dangerous.

Today, @SanfordBishop and I introduced the FRESH Act – a bipartisan proposal that helps address this issue.

Read more: https://t.co/y6nZzPMpsw
https://t.co/8gLl4C1rZo

The Senate voted today to acquit President Trump on all impeachment charges. 

I’m glad that this political sideshow has finally come to an end. It is time now for Congress to get back to work and use what little time it has left to pass meaningful legislation for all Americans.

In honor of National School Counseling Week, I want to recognize Five Forks Middle School’s Laura Ross for being named the 2020 School Counselor of the Year! 

It was a pleasure having you in the office last week! https://t.co/wU1dy8j6PI

There was a lot going in Washington D.C. last week. We saw the #USMCA trade deal get signed into law, the @USCBO release its annual report, and the #impeachment trial near its final stages. 

Here’s a full recap of last week’s legislative business: https://t.co/qZYPt2G187

The December jobs numbers are in. Georgia capped off 2019 with an all-time low unemployment rate of 3.2%. 

I look forward to seeing this momentum continue in 2020! https://t.co/PzChONZlcr

President @realDonaldTrump officially signed the #USMCA trade deal into law today.

This bipartisan deal is a huge win for Georgia’s farmers, manufactures, and small businesses! https://t.co/GhTaCQ7AEn

On Friday, Washington, DC, became the site of the world’s largest pro-life march as thousands descended on the nation’s capital. I would like to thank the 7th District constituents and all the folks from across the State of Georgia who stopped by the office before the rally. https://t.co/tA9BpIqsBH
Last week, https://t.co/l6uTHuAc8v announced its rankings for the top 10 public schools in Georgia. I was pleased to see that four of our public schools made the list! https://t.co/wiiGdxoj4y

Today on National #LawEnforcementAppreciationDay, I would like to thank the brave men and women who risk their lives every day to protect our community.
 
#GA07 is grateful for your service and sacrifice #ThinBlueLine https://t.co/SNMc8s5kFu

.@POTUS @realDonaldTrump is right when he says that Iran has been a “destructive and destabilizing” force in the Middle East and beyond, and I will work with him to ensure that Iran is not allowed to threaten the civilized world.  (2/2)

I agree with President Trump when he says America is ready to embrace peace with all who seek it.  That said, America will fiercely guard the safety of all Americans, especially our men and women in uniform. (1/2)

232 years ago, Georgia was the fourth state admitted into the Union.

Happy Birthday to this wonderful state we are fortunate enough to call home! https://t.co/KOUKFlS4dQ

As 2019 comes to a close, I hope that you & your family had a wonderful holiday season.  

I remain honored to represent our community in Congress, and I will continue to be a strong voice for Forsyth and Gwinnett. I wish you a very Happy New Year with friends & loved ones! #GA07 https://t.co/9U40DnLvKk
